metadata.title: CVE-2015-1822 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
chrony before 1.31.1 does not initialize the last "next" pointer whensaving unacknowledged replies to command requests, which allows remoteauthenticated users to cause a denial of service (uninitialized pointerdereference and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via alarge number of command requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 3.2-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2-4ubuntu1').
